page.title: 12 MILK QUOTAS
page.content: In 1984 the European Common Market decided that too much milk was being produced by dairy farmers and that the production of milk would have to be cut by 10%.The farmers became very angry as they would lose money and have to sell some of their cattle. In April 1984,Mr Michael Joplin the Minister of Agriculture came to the village of LLangadog for a meeting.The village was packed with angry farmers from all over Dyfed who had come to demonstrate against the milk quotas. Milk was sprayed on the roads,cars and tractors were used to block all the roads leading out of the village,and Mr.Joplin had to remain in the village Community Centre for a long time.He was later allowed to leave after agreeing to to talk to some of the farmers about the milk quotas.
